pullRequest.title: Adds support for the mime_type and content_size parameters in simple search.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Adds support for the mime_type and content_size parameters in simple search.

JIRA Ticket: https://jira.lyrasis.org/browse/FCREPO-3365 and https://jira.lyrasis.org/browse/FCREPO-3346

Other Relevant Links (Mailing list discussion, related pull requests, etc.)

What does this Pull Request do?
This PR adds support for content_size and mime_type fields.
It should be noted that currently only NonRDFSources have non-null content sizes and mime types.  If and when that changes, the search index will be updated accordingly without further code updates.
How should this be tested?
# create a  container:
curl -u fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin  -X PUT http://localhost:8080/rest/test
# create two binary resources with differing content lengths
 curl -u fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin http://localhost:8080/rest/test -H "Slug:binary1" -H "Link: <http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#NonRDFSource>; rel=type" -v -H "Content-Type: text/plain"  -X POST --data "text" -i
 curl -u fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin http://localhost:8080/rest/test -H "Slug:binary2" -H "Link: <http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#NonRDFSource>; rel=type" -v -H "Content-Type: text/plain"  -X POST --data "a bit more text" -i

# do a search that returns all results: 
curl -u fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin "http://localhost:8080/rest/fcr:search?condition=fedora_id%3Dtest*"
# verify that two results were returned  and that the mime_type and content_size fields were returned in the results.
# search where content size > 0
curl -u fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin "http://localhost:8080/rest/fcr:search?condition=fedora_id%3Dtest*&condition=content_size%3E0"
# verify two results returned (test/binary1 and test/binary2)

# search where content size > 10
curl -u fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin "http://localhost:8080/rest/fcr:search?condition=fedora_id%3Dtest*&condition=content_size%3E10"
# verify only binary2 is returned.


Interested parties
Tag (@ mention) interested parties or, if unsure, @fcrepo4/committers
